summary: Rolando Masferrer was a Cuban exile figure involved in various activities, including plotting against the Haitian government. He had connections to the CIA, as evidenced by concerns over potential damage to CIA Miami operations due to his prosecution for a planned Haitian invasion. Documents suggest investigations into his activities and possible connections within the Cuban exile community. There are also allegations of CIA involvement in his assassination. He was a former Cuban senator. The timeline of his involvement spans from at least 1960 to 1976, with a focus on the period between 1967 and 1968 regarding the Haitian invasion plot and subsequent legal issues.
significance: While the documents do not directly link Rolando Masferrer to the JFK assassination, his involvement in Cuban exile activities and alleged CIA connections place him within the broader context of individuals and groups potentially relevant to understanding the political climate and events surrounding the assassination. The documents suggest that he was a person of interest to both the CIA and FBI.
